links.title: Analysts Have Conflicting Sentiments on These Consumer Goods Companies: Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) and Wolverine World Wide (NYSE: WWW) | Analyst Ratings
links.description: By Austin Angelo Companies in the Consumer Goods sector have received a lot of coverage today as analysts weigh in on Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) and Wolverine World Wide (NYSE: WWW). Apple (AAPL) In a report released yesterday, Tim Long from BMO Capital reiterated a Hold rating on Apple, with a price target of $199.

message.body: Apple's Stock Hits All-Time High After Beating Q3 Earnings, Sales Estimates https://benzinga.com/z/12112323 $AAPL

links.title: Apple's Stock Hits All-Time High After Beating Q3 Earnings, Sales Estimates (NASDAQ:AAPL), Strong Guidance
links.description: Apple, Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) prevails as front-runner over other FANG members, as the tech giant exceeded earnings expectations. Apple reported a Q3 revenue of $53.3 billion, accounting for a 17-percent increase from last year, as well as a 40-percent increase in earnings per share at $2.34 against a $2.18 estimate.

messages.body: $AAPL Let the haters hate, the spinners spin. All that matters........
$AAPL https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-08-01/china-s-huawei-passes-apple-in-smartphone-share-for-first-time

links.title: Huawei Passes Apple in Smartphone Share for the First Time
links.description: Huawei Technologies Co. pulled ahead of Apple Inc. to claim the No. 2 position in global smartphone shipments in the second quarter just behind Samsung Electronics Co., solidifying the rise of Chinese competitors. Huawei shipped 54.2 million phones in the quarter, 41 percent more than a year earlier, to jump ahead of the iPhone maker for the first time, according to market research firm IDC.

links.title: We're Not Quite Done With Volatility
links.description: We're Not Quite Done With Volatility Remember how sour sentiment had gotten on Monday? Remember the put/call ratio soaring up to 112%? Remember the equity put/call ratio up over 70% for the first time in weeks? How much shall we wager that after Apple's beat all that concern tapers off?
